question: How do social media algorithms affect political polarization, and what interventions might help?

expert_sources.title: Exposure to opposing views on social media can increase political polarization
Filter Bubbles, Echo Chambers, and Online News Consumption
The Psychology of Online Political Hostility

key_findings.finding: Recommendation algorithms optimize for engagement, which correlates with emotional and divisive content
Filter bubbles exist but their magnitude is debated; people self-select into homogeneous environments
Exposure to opposing views can backfire and increase polarization
Outrage and moral-emotional language spreads faster on social media
Accuracy nudges can reduce misinformation sharing
2023 Facebook experiments showed limited algorithm impact on key attitudes

known_counterarguments.argument: Polarization predates social media and has multiple causes
known_counterarguments.validity: Valid, social media is one factor among many

known_counterarguments.argument: Most people don't engage deeply with political content online
known_counterarguments.validity: True, heavy users drive much political engagement

known_counterarguments.argument: Traditional media also contributes to polarization
known_counterarguments.validity: Valid, cable news effects are significant

areas_of_uncertainty: Causal direction between algorithms and attitudes
Effectiveness of proposed interventions at scale

bonus_points: Distinction between perceived and actual polarization
